publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2572 Christopher Harvie: Return of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge Ferry—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Government and Forth Ports on securing a new operator for the Rosyth-Zeebrugge ferry service, which will resume in spring 2009; welcomes the decision of the new ferry operator, Norfolkline, to deploy a new vessel on the route and match the schedule previously provided and hopes that it will consider an extension to the previous schedule; further hopes that this resumption of a direct maritime contact with Europe, with its beneficial impact on freight transport and tourism, will lead to increased prosperity for Rosyth, Fife and Scotland in general, and encourages the governments of Scotland and Flanders to mark the occasion of the resumption of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge ferry with a celebration commemorating Scotland’s links with the Low Countries.

S3M-2572 Christopher Harvie: Return of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge Ferry—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Government and Forth Ports on securing a new operator for the Rosyth-Zeebrugge ferry service, which will resume in spring 2009; welcomes the decision of the new ferry operator, Norfolkline, to deploy a new vessel on the route and match the schedule previously provided and hopes that it will consider an extension to the previous schedule; further hopes that this resumption of a direct maritime contact with Europe, with its beneficial impact on freight transport and tourism, will lead to increased prosperity for Rosyth, Fife and Scotland in general, and encourages the governments of Scotland and Flanders to mark the occasion of the resumption of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge ferry with a celebration commemorating Scotland’s links with the Low Countries. Supported by: Brian Adam*, Bob Doris*, Stuart McMillan*, Kenneth Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Jamie Hepburn*, Bashir Ahmad*, Keith Brown*, Robin Harper*, Bill Kidd*, Bill Wilson*, Angela Constance*, Jim Tolson*
S3M-2572 Return of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge Ferry (lodged on 18 September 2008) Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Christina McKelvie*, Alex Neil*, Christine Grahame*, Rob Gibson*, Michael Matheson*
S3M-2572 Return of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge Ferry (lodged on 18 September 2008) Roseanna Cunningham*, Dave Thompson*
S3M-2572 Return of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge Ferry (lodged on 18 September 2008) Aileen Campbell*

*S3M-2572 Christopher Harvie: Return of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge Ferry—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Government and Forth Ports on securing a new operator for the Rosyth-Zeebrugge ferry service, which will resume in spring 2009; welcomes the decision of the new ferry operator, Norfolkline, to deploy a new vessel on the route and match the schedule previously provided and hopes that it will consider an extension to the previous schedule; further hopes that this resumption of a direct maritime contact with Europe, with its beneficial impact on freight transport and tourism, will lead to increased prosperity for Rosyth, Fife and Scotland in general, and encourages the governments of Scotland and Flanders to mark the occasion of the resumption of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge ferry with a celebration commemorating Scotland’s links with the Low Countries.
S3M-2572 Return of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge Ferry (lodged on 30 September 2008) Sandra White*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Jack McConnell*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-2572 Christopher Harvie: Return of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge Ferry—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Government and Forth Ports on securing a new operator for the Rosyth-Zeebrugge ferry service, which will resume in spring 2009; welcomes the decision of the new ferry operator, Norfolkline, to deploy a new vessel on the route and match the schedule previously provided and hopes that it will consider an extension to the previous schedule; further hopes that this resumption of a direct maritime contact with Europe, with its beneficial impact on freight transport and tourism, will lead to increased prosperity for Rosyth, Fife and Scotland in general, and encourages the governments of Scotland and Flanders to mark the occasion of the resumption of the Rosyth-Zeebrugge ferry with a celebration commemorating Scotland’s links with the Low Countries. Supported by: Brian Adam, Bob Doris, Stuart McMillan, Kenneth Gibson, Alasdair Allan, Jamie Hepburn, Bashir Ahmad, Keith Brown, Robin Harper, Bill Kidd, Bill Wilson, Angela Constance, Jim Tolson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Christina McKelvie, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Rob Gibson, Michael Matheson, Roseanna Cunningham, Dave Thompson, Aileen Campbell, Sandra White, Joe FitzPatrick, Jack McConnell, Gil Paterson
